titleStmt.title: N. S. Ray to James F. Robinson
CWG7883

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
B. Spalding, President.
N. S. Ray, Cashier.
Commercial Bank of Kentucky,
Lebanon, Ky., 186
Cashier,
Dear Sir:
Your favor of the inst. has been received with enclosures as stated.

Lebanon Marion Co Ky
Feby 7th 1863
Gov. J. F. Robinson
Frankfort Ky
DrSr
Since the death of our clerk A. Ryder we have no Notary Public
I wish to ask the ap^p^ointment for our new clerk James. H Vivion. He is a man of character & integrity. His appointment will much oblige

Yr obt svt
N. S. Ray Cas
